answers.answer: Hi,I understand what a huge shock this diagnosis was, for both you and Mom to suddenly have to deal with.We all feel that way when the diagnosis is cancer, it's an awful blow and turns your world upside down. You and she are confused and I guess she's dealing with it in her fear and confusion.It's a very good sign that she's obviously ready for a fight to treat, and deal with the disease.Give her some time, and be there for her. She's going to need you more than she knows, and she'll reach out to you very soon.I'm sure she'll need surgery to remove as much of the cancer as possible. Make sure she has a GYN/ONC surgeon to do her surgery. They are specialists who are very well trained and competent, to have  the best outcome. I expect that she'll also need chemo to kill any remaining cancer cells, the surgery is unable to get.She'll see an oncologist to set up her treatments once she's recovered from surgery which will also stage her disease, according to what the path lab at the he hospital finds when they test the removed tissue.I hope this was of some help to you. Please keep us informed we're here to support you and Mom when you need us.Jane

question: My mother was recently hospitalized after she got dehydrated when she was throwing up for two weeks straight.  She wasn't eating at all.  When she got to the hospital, many tests were performed on her and she was subsequently diagnosed with Ovarian Cancer.  I'm in total shock because she had no symptoms other than the throwing up, which I did not think was a symptom at all.  Her Doctor became concerned when he felt her abdomen and so he performed a stomach xray and found a liter of fluid in her belly.  Other than Diabetes which she and I both have, my mother never had any serious illness.  This came out of left field.  A tumor was spotted after a routine CT scan and the Doctor performed a CA125 blood test, which confirmed the diagnosis of Ovarian Cancer.  I'm really scared and don't know how to deal with this.  My mother is ready to go to the biggest and best hospital to beat this.  Every time I try to talk to her or help her, she tells me to go away.  How normal is this?  I want to help her, but I don't know how.Thanks!
title: Mother was just diagnosed with Ovarian Cancer
